title: Andy Murray speaks out after beating Stan Wawrinka to win first ATP title in over two years
text:
Andy Murray beat Stan Wawrinka to win the European Open (AP Photo/Francisco Seco)

Andy Murray admits he ‘didn’t expect to be in this position’ after beating Stan Wawrinka to win the European Open.

The Scot, who has been recovering from hip resurfacing surgery since the end of January, has won his first ATP singles final since March 2017.

But he was forced to come from behind to see off Wawrinka in a nervy final in Antwerp.

Murray lost the first set 3-6 but then went on to win 6-4 6-4 to complete a remarkable revival.

‘It means a lot. Last few years have been extremely difficult,’ Murray said after the match.

Murray was clearly emotional after the match in Antwerp (AP Photo/Francisco Seco)

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Both me and Stan have had a lot of injury problems in the last couple of years.

‘It’s amazing to be back, playing against him in the final like that. I think it was a great match.

‘Stan was playing unbelievable. I just managed to hang in a bit at the end of the second set and the third set was extremely close again.

‘I didn’t expect to be in this position at all. I’m happy, very happy.

Stan Wawrinka won the first set but could not stop Murray’s comeback (AP Photo/Francisco Seco)

‘Stan is a brilliant player. He’s won many big tournaments. We know each other’s games well, we’ve played many tough matches in the past. I expected another one today and that’s what I got.

‘I’ve really enjoyed my week here. The atmosphere the last few days has been amazing.

‘To have crowds like this over the weekend, its really important to sustain the tournament. Thank you for everyone who came out to support the event.

‘I’m very proud of the win this week.’
description: Andy Murray admits he 'didn't expect to be in this position' after beating Stan Wawrinka to win the European Open. The Scot, who has been recovering from hip resurfacing surgery...
